creditline: Gift of funds from the Collection in Focus Guides of The Minneapolis Institute of Arts and The Christina N. and Swan J. Turnblad Memorial Fund
description: design of magpies and willow on brown and dark blue silk
text: <I>Atsuita<I> are boldly patterned inner robes that are typically used for men's roles in traditional No_ theater. Although mostly covered by voluminous jackets, the sumptuous designs of the <I>atsuita<I> are revealed when an actor moves or slips his jacket off one shoulder as he readies for combat.
title: Noh robe (atsuita)
